com.stormpath.spring.security.provider

Class UsernamePasswordAuthenticationTokenFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.spring.security.provider.UsernamePasswordAuthenticationTokenFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthenticationTokenFactory

    public class UsernamePasswordAuthenticationTokenFactory
extends Object
implements AuthenticationTokenFactory
    A AuthenticationTokenFactory implementation that creates representation of a username and password token. The principal stored in the token is an instance of StormpathUserDetails which contains information about the Stormpath Account for the authenticated user, such as href, given name, username, etc.
    Since:
    0.2.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • UsernamePasswordAuthenticationTokenFactory

    • Method Detail

      • createAuthenticationToken

        public org.springframework.security.core.Authentication createAuthenticationToken(Object principal,
                                                                                  Object credentials,
                                                                                  Collection<? extends org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> authorities,
                                                                                  Account account)
        Description copied from interface: AuthenticationTokenFactory
        Creates a token for an authenticated principal once the request has been processed by the StormpathAuthenticationProvider.authenticate(Authentication) method.

        Once the request has been authenticated, this Authentication will usually be stored in a thread-local SecurityContext managed by the org.springframework.security.core.context.SecurityContextHolder.

        Specified by:
        createAuthenticationToken in interface AuthenticationTokenFactory
        Parameters:
        principal - The identity of the principal. In the case of an authentication with username and password, this would be the username.
        credentials - The credentials that prove the principal is correct. This is usually a password, but could be anything relevant to the AuthenticationManager
        authorities - the authorities that the principal has been granted
        account - the Stormpath Account corresponding to the principal
        Returns:
        the Authentication token representing the authenticated principal
